skillTree.name: Norscan Warhorse
skillTree.description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

skillTree.name: Manticore
skillTree.description: Manticores are highly prized by the Shaman Warleaders, for they are creatures bathed in magic and as cruel as their riders.

skillTree.name: Voice of the Dark Gods
skillTree.description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Cruel Overseer
skillTree.description: Many Chieftains and Warlords dont really care about most of the vital but boring tasks that keep a settlement afloat, its warehouses full of supplies and its dwellers ready to fight, letting, or ordering, their shamans do the hard work

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Forbidden Knowledge
skillTree.description: For a follower of the Dark Gods, nothing is forbidden

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn

skillTree.name: Indulger in the Exotic
skillTree.description: The Serpent's temptations come in many forms, all of them designed to appeal to the twisted desires buried deep within us all.

skillTree.name: Intoxicating Visions
skillTree.description: Seductive images of sensual luxuries may tempt the enemy from their chosen paths onto roads much, much less travelled and from which there can be no return.

skillTree.name: Seduction of the Serpent
skillTree.description: Although the youngest of the Dark Gods, the Serpent is no less potent and can bind mortals to eternal service with alluring visions or tantalising temptations.

skillTree.name: Noxious Vessel
skillTree.description: Thusly, the virulent maladies of the Crow are borne forth to repulse and infect its mortal foes; there lieth victory eternal.

skillTree.name: Putrefying Ooze
skillTree.description: This fetid, disgusting pus is so repulsive to the untainted that it mimics traditional armour of far greater substance.

skillTree.name: Plague of the Crow
skillTree.description: Unstable and miscreated, the Crow's strength spreads and grows like the most successful of diseases, consuming all before consuming itself and beginning again.

skillTree.name: Spirit Wanderer
skillTree.description: More fool they who go to war and quest with minds unfocused, for they risk the Eagle's desolate, underhand deceptions.

skillTree.name: Dark Deceiver
skillTree.description: The Eagle weaves a complex web of duplicity around its servants, further bracing their combat abilities in subtle, unexpected ways.

skillTree.name: Sorcery of the Eagle
skillTree.description: As the undisputed master of magic, the Eagle uses complex sorcery to influence its followers and draw opponents into his multifarious, interwoven schemes.

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.name: Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma
skillTree.description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Smoke & Mirrors
skillTree.description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

skillTree.name: The Enfeebling Foe
skillTree.description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Withering
skillTree.description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Penumbral Pendulum
skillTree.description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Pit of Shades
skillTree.description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Okkam's Mindrazor
skillTree.description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Martial Mastery (Skill Dump)
skillTree.description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.name: Defensive Dedication (Skill Dump)
skillTree.description: Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.name: The Will of the Gods
skillTree.description: Only shamans of great power, ambition and ruthlessness can attract the gaze of the Gods and gather an army or even entire tribes under their command

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Marauder and Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ready for the Long War
skillTree.description: Those who follow a shaman find that their leader is not interested in fleeting glory. For shamans, looting and sacking the southerners lands is not the end, but a meaning to an end. In this case, fueling the eternal war against the unbelievers

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +4 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +8 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +12 for all Human Melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beast Slayers
skillTree.description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +3% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Unnatural Selection
skillTree.description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +9% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Brawns, no Brains
skillTree.description: ItÂ´s easy for a cunning shaman to get those most dim-witted of creatures to obey him just in exchange for some food

skillTree.name: Forsaken by Men
skillTree.description: Some creatures are too unnatural to be trusted by even the Norscan tribesmen, but as long as they acknowledge the Dark Gods as their masters, a shaman can find a use for them

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +12 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +12 for Fimirs and Skinwolves
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Paragons of Strength
skillTree.description: These creatures travel wherever they want and destroy wathever they want. ItÂ´s no surprise that Norscan shamans will employ all sorcery at their disposal to make them join their armies

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +5 for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +7% for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +10% for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +15 for Manticore, Giant, Wyrm and Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Champions of the North
skillTree.description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hardened Hunters
skillTree.description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Icy Wrath
skillTree.description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves, and Marauder Chariots units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hulks of Death
skillTree.description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Frost Wyrm, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Frost Wyrm, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Frost Wyrm, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Stand or Die!
skillTree.description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.

skillTree.name: Fight or Die!
skillTree.description: There is no other choice. There never was.

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Takers of All
skillTree.description: That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.

skillTree.name: Serve or Die
skillTree.description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

skillTree.name: Norse Resilience
skillTree.description: The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.

skillTree.name: Swelling of Doom
skillTree.description: Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Ruination
skillTree.description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.name: Savage Skills
skillTree.description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +4%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

skillTree.name: Unnatural Healing
skillTree.description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.

effects.description:
Attrition: -5% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Fuelled by War
skillTree.description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.

skillTree.name: Spawn of Chaos
skillTree.description: The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +150
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Mystifying Miasma [HIDDEN]
backgroundSkills.description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

backgroundSkills.name: Blind
backgroundSkills.description: Although the eyes do not see, the other senses remain open.

backgroundSkills.name: Boring
backgroundSkills.description: "Another speech? Very wellâ€¦ does it have to be soâ€¦ lengthy?"

backgroundSkills.name: Choleric
backgroundSkills.description: Does a rage as hot as Khorne's burn within?

backgroundSkills.name: Clumsy
backgroundSkills.description: There are drunk Ogres more sure-footed than this one.

backgroundSkills.name: Misshapen
backgroundSkills.description: Deformed from birth or made so by the Ruinous Powers, yet there is honour within the prison of flesh.

backgroundSkills.name: Easily Deceived
backgroundSkills.description: "Tzeentch will have so much fun with you, puppet!"

backgroundSkills.name: Easily Distracted
backgroundSkills.description: "Look! Over there â€“ a Snotling showing its arse!"

backgroundSkills.name: Easily Trapped
backgroundSkills.description: To trap a fool is easy; to trap a kingâ€¦ perhaps even easier.

backgroundSkills.name: Honourable
backgroundSkills.description: Honour is everything!

backgroundSkills.name: Intelligent
backgroundSkills.description: In this age of blood and battle, intellect is an underrated gift.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Maimed Arm
backgroundSkills.description: "This one is armless, sir."

backgroundSkills.name: Maimed Leg
backgroundSkills.description: "No, not drunk, just legless."

backgroundSkills.name: Melancholic
backgroundSkills.description: "Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor â€“ a champion?"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: -5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Phlegmatic
backgroundSkills.description: A calming presence can be a steadying handâ€¦ but also disquieting.

backgroundSkills.name: Sanguine
backgroundSkills.description: An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.

backgroundSkills.name: Disfiguring Scar
backgroundSkills.description: Such an ugly scar is always memorable.

backgroundSkills.name: Distinguishing Scar
backgroundSkills.description: Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.

backgroundSkills.name: Stupid
backgroundSkills.description: Shares the intellect of a River Troll.

backgroundSkills.name: Uncompromising
backgroundSkills.description: Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Diabolic Splendour
backgroundSkills.description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
